name: The Atlantic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The good points are that this hotel has amazing views of St Ouens bay the sunset is amazing, the staff are lovely always willing to help absolutely nothing is to much trouble they really work so hard and their standards are high the staff cannot be faulted, the atmosphere is relaxed the standards of house keeping are excellant ----the not so good things this was our 10th stay they had us down as our first visit, the little extra's are gone,restaurant and room service menu is very very expensive (room service very limited menu), the beds are very hard and the rooms are so hot at night we could not sleep no aircon in this hotel which you would expect and the rooms really do need upgrading as it is not cheap to stay here.
reviews.title: Staff are so friendly, excelllant standards and service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: This is our second stay at the Atlantic and we were looked after extremely well. The staff are very friendly and take care of every request and ensure you have a great stay. We ate in the Ocean restaurant twice and on both occasions the food was amazing. Martinho and his team do a great job in ensuring the service is perfect not only at dinner but also at breakfast which is marvellous.
reviews.title: Great Hotel - Excellent Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We have just spent a week at the Atlantic and enjoyed every minute The rooms are very comfortable with excellent housekeepng. The standard of service was exceptional in the restaurant and the food was fantastic-the bar snacks were also good. Nothing was too much trouble fo the reception staff.
reviews.title: Excellent Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our first visit to the hotel for a week's break and we cannot wait to return. The atmosphere is quiet, relaxing with an air of understated luxury. Exquisitely furnished, with the highest standards of service and attention to detail from Reception to the Room staff. Every request is dealt with promptly and efficiently. Staff are superbly professional, friendly and helpful. The restaurant is a delight and the gourmet menus quite amazing. The incredibly high standard of service offered by the Restaurant Manager, Martinho de Souso and his staff is unobstrusive and totally faultless, a joy to behold. The setting of the hotel is stunning with beautiful grounds, wonderful views of St. Ouens Bay and the chance of a magical sunset over dinner.
reviews.title: Quite Exceptional, Very Special Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just come back from a lovely relaxing weekend staying at the Atlantic. Very clean hotel with attentive staff and good food. We were lucky to eat in the Ocean restaurant on the Sat night although would recommend that this is booked well in advance as we could only get a very early time and other hotel guests were being turned away. I would certainly agree with other comments that the beds are extremely hard and TV could be updated. Whilst you don't go away to watch TV, I would expect that a hotel of this class would have a flat screen TV however the TV in the room was big, bulky and in a cabinet which when opened restricted the view of the screen and took a lot of space in the room. Also a DVD player and a mini-fridge would also be welcomed as they supply you with complimentary water but is very warm and not chilled and both these features are what you would normally expect in similar standard hotels.
reviews.title: Luxury Weekend Break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007
reviews.text: Spent two nights at the Atlantic Hotel on the 28th and 29th July. A very impressive hotel, not cheap, but well worth the money. When we arrived the room wasn't quite ready, but we were treated to complimentary drinks and our bags were unloaded from the car. The room was fantsatic with a balcony over-looking the golf course and drinks were reasonably priced. Didn't have dinner at the hotel, which seemed to irritate the manager Sean a little, who made a rather cocky remark when we told him we'd had dinner at a Pizza restaurant in St Brelade's Bay, but apart from his pretenious attitude the rest of the staff were absolutely brilliant and very competent. Breakfast was top class and the whole experience of the stay was highly enjoyable.
reviews.title: Top Quality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We have just returned from a trip to the Atlantic Hotel, our second visit. The last time we went was at Christmas 2006, but this stay was just superb. The chefs excelled themselves; the food was faultless and everyone went out of their way to accommodate us, foodwise, etc. One of our party had a nut allergy and every care was taken with all her food.
reviews.title: The Best of British with a real touch of class!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The staff really seem to enjoy their jobs and they also seem to care that the guests enjoy their stay... how many times do you find that these days, even in very upmarket hotels.
reviews.title: The most wonderful experience!

likes.liked: — Wonderful attentive service and general atmosphere
likes.disliked: — Nothing major but if I had to be picky - no air con

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are seasoned travellers, preferring to stay in 5 star+ accommodation, and so I feel that the Atlantic has certainly managed to acquit itself very well indeed.
reviews.title: Great relaxing break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One small gripe: it was very warm while we were on Jersey this time and the hotel does not have airconditioning. The dining room was often very stuffy, despite ceiling fans, and our newly refurbished room (which was really lovely), only provided us with a small electric fan. If one was staying here in very hot weather, I think the bedrooms would be unbearably hot. It's a great shame that having completed major refurbishments, they didn't try and install some airconditioning.
reviews.title: Great Stay at The Atlantic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: What can I say. Always very good and relaxing. Teenager gets own room (FAB). Champagne on arrival as welcome back and good gourmet menu. Staff helpful nothing is any trouble. Fantastic setting. Don't be put off by the 1960 exterior very modern inside and always a good welcome.
reviews.title: Excellent as ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Down side - agree with skillster, beds are hard, had a sore back by end of 3 nights and TV's are not up to standard. Rooms are a bit 'samey' think Hilton although bathrooms are nice and showers good.
reviews.title: Exceptional hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: A three night stay that had the calming effect of a whole week away. The standard of this hotel was exceptional in all departments from the welcome at reception to attention to detail and professionalism in the dining room. Friendly, efficient and knowledgable staff and well chosen decor all set in beautiful surroundings. We will be back !
reviews.title: Wonderful stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Extremely nice hotel; nice decoration, delicious food (service can be a bit long with a young child), some rooms are small (upstairs) but other (downstairs with a garden are big), nice gardens (lots of flowers), 2 polls (indoor and outdoor) but small.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Quiet and relaxing
reviews.title: Near perfection

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: How I would love to give this hotel a full five stars - it's nearly there but as previous reviewers have identified, there are some minor niggles. On the plus side, the hotel is stylish and well presented, extremely clean and the service is absolutely faultless. The food is appetising and menus interesting. However, at this level, we would have expected a fridge, fresh milk and a mini bar as standard. The television in the room is old fashioned with poor reception and housed in a large cabinet which takes up a lot of space in the room. All in all however, we had a very enjoyable stay and will probably return in the future.
reviews.title: Lovely stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: My wife, our baby son and I stayed for a long weekend in August whilst exploring the Island. From the moment we arrived service was friendly and attentive without being overwhelming. We asked for a fridge in our our room to store baby food and this was provided without fuss. The restaurant team were especially kind, accommodating our son with a high chair and making a fuss of him when it would have been so easy to be sniffy given the Michelin star and concern for other diners.
reviews.title: Flawless service across the board

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food in the evening was exceptional and service flawless, there are three menus, a taster menu, a la carte and table d'hote. The wine list included very reasonable sommelier recommendations for bottles around the £30 mark. Breakfast is a treat, top notch locally sourced ingredients wherever possible. The sausage in the full jersey breakfast was especially good.
reviews.title: Almost perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel has an outdoor and indoor pool, a small gym, a pleasant secluded library area and places to sit quietly during the day.
reviews.title: Our favourite hotel - anywhere.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our standard room was reasonably spacious, only let down by a slightly over-firm bed made up of two large single mattresses rather than one king size. Next time we'll go for a garden suite.
reviews.title: Jersey break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was amazing. From the moment we were greated and our bags were taken out of our hands, to the moment we left, we felt utterly spoilt.
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It has a wonderful location, we opened the sliding doors in our room and had a view of the beach and the ocean, which we could hear each night as we went to sleep.
reviews.title: Our first 5 out of 5!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As there are only 50 rooms, it never seemed crowded or noisy, even though at breakfast and dinner the restaurant was full. Some people may think it is quite expensive, but it is worth every penny.
reviews.title: Sheer Luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was out of this world, and every day we looked forward to dinner to see what delights the chef was treating us to! Breakfast was also tasty, with a llarge variety of freshly prepared hot and cold food.
reviews.title: Breakfast very poor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Third trip back to the Atlantic and it's still as good as ever.
reviews.title: Still as good as ever
Discreet comfort
reviews.text: Service, setting, food - all great.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: If I had any criticisms, they'd be - update the gym, duvets for the beds not sheets (even my mum has changed to duvets) and stop the chef getting too fancy (the kids would have liked food with a bit more substance).
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But these are minor issues - it's a great place.
reviews.title: Very Special Hotel for our Very Special Occasion

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here with my very elderly mother. The room on the ground floor was excellent with a pleasant view over the gardens and the sea. The service was excellent, nothing seemed to be too much trouble. I was not able to try the restuarant but the breakfast was of super quality. I would certainly return here in the future.
reviews.title: Absolutely Fabulous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: I stayed with my family (wife and two teenage children) for 3 nights and we had a great time.
reviews.title: An Excellent Hotel with Great Food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel itself doesn't look great, the type of monstrosity they used to build in the '60s and '70s. However, inside it's really well fitted out.
reviews.title: Amazing 40th Birthday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bedrooms are good but perhaps on the weak side for a 5-star hotel, in that they are stuffy if it's hot at night (no A/C) and our bedrooms (adjoining rooms) were above the indoor fish pond and, when the fire exit to the bedrooms was propped open (which it often was), the noise from the fountain could be heard all night, which is annoying.
reviews.title: Very good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Also, the gym is extermely out-dated. It badly needs renovating as the equipment must be about 20 years old.
reviews.title: Not so Fast!! - Not so Nice.....

likes.liked: — The island of Jersey is beautiful - the people are nice
likes.disliked: — Food, Food, Food and getting insulted by management

reviews.title: Super hotel - will stay there again
reviews.text: The food, however, is superb and I can see why the restaurant has a Michelin star. The staff are all friendly and the location is excellent.

description: One of Jersey's finest luxury hotels which combines breathtaking ocean views with a Michelin-starred restaurant, The Atlantic is situated on one of the most stunning sites in the Channel Islands. As one of the top hotels in the British Isles and a proud member of Small Luxury Hotels of the World, the combination of timeless elegance and secluded location makes The Atlantic the perfect hideaway on an island rich in heritage and natural beauty.
